docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 24.--Official information was received at the State Department today that the Argentine Government had accepted the American proposal for the renunciation of monopolistic cable privileges held by the Western Telegraph Company, a...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 24.--Official information was received at the State Department today that the Argentine Government had accepted the American proposal for the renunciation of monopolistic cable privileges held by the Western Telegraph Company, a British concern,...
docs.abstract: Argentine Govt agrees to Sec Hughes's "open door" plan, opens Miami-Barbados cable, and direct communication to So Amer

headline.main: ARGENTINA RENOUNCES CABLE MONOPOLIES; Joins Other South American Countries for Hughes's OpenDoor Policy.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE.; German Mark Records Further Drop--Sympathetic Weakness in French and Belgian.

docs.snippet: It is reported that the British firm of Vickers  Co. has purchased a large interest in the Reschitza Company, the principal steel industry in Rumania, situated in the Banat, formerly a portion of Austria-Hungary.
docs.lead_paragraph: It is reported that the British firm of Vickers Co. has purchased a large interest in the Reschitza Company, the principal steel industry in Rumania, situated in the Banat, formerly a portion of Austria-Hungary.

headline.main: Notes on Trade and Industry Abroad; British In Rumanian Steel. Finland's Export Trade. Farm Implement Sales in Spain. Oil Facilities at Havre. Brazil-Uruguay Bridge. German Artificial-Silk Industry. Coal Discovery In Mexico Liquor Imports Prohibited. Rug Factories in Peking. Bean "Boards" Something New. Copper From Belgian Congo. Velvets at Rio de Janeiro. New Cane Planting Machine.

docs.snippet: W.H. Hudson, a prominent figure in English letters and the literature of nature, died in his home in London on Aug. 18, it was learned yesterday.
docs.lead_paragraph: W.H. Hudson, a prominent figure in English letters and the literature of nature, died in his home in London on Aug. 18, it was learned yesterday.

headline.main: NOTED NATURALIST, W.H. HUDSON, DEAD; England's Foremost Writer on Bird Life Died Recently at His Home in London. HIS BOOKS OF RARE CHARM Author of "The Purple Land" Was an Authority on South American Ornithology.
